intro: Clibadium caudatum, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
